transcript: The main navigation for the application runs along the left side of the page. In this black bar, there's different options depending on what you need to perform and each of them has its own menu of further options, so starting at the top home will bring you back to this dashboard page. The create menu, anything that has to do with creating and that you might send out will live here. So that's building and sending emails, SMS, text messages, video and other dynamic tools like countdown clocks or image carousels, templates, calendar invites, forms, surveys, polls and quizzes. All of that will live inside the create menu. Next down reports multiple different types of reports for you to use. The next option down is Subs, so that's our subscribers. Anything that we need to do to manage our audience would be in this menu and then admin is the last main option here and this is just settings. In the bottom left we see the chooser and the chooser is where you can store all of the files that you might need to use in your emails. So that's your images and word documents and PDFs and other files like that. There is access to help resources. And then a log out option. If you happen to be in an account that has multiple sub accounts. You can toggle between those sub accounts in the very top right of the app, so here you'll find your company name and then your sub accounts if you click on the one that you see visible, this is the one I'm currently inside of. I can click that and see the list of other sub accounts that I can switch into.

questions.question: Where is the main navigation located in the application?
questions.answer: The main navigation is located along the left side of the page in a black vertical bar.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'Home' option in the main navigation?
questions.answer: The 'Home' option in the main navigation brings you back to the dashboard page.

questions.question: What types of tools and features are found under the 'Create' menu?
questions.answer: Under the 'Create' menu, you can find tools and features for building and sending emails, SMS text messages, videos, dynamic tools like countdown clocks and image carousels, templates, calendar invites, forms, surveys, polls, and quizzes.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Reports' menu in the navigation?
questions.answer: The 'Reports' menu provides access to multiple different types of reports that you can use to analyze your email campaigns and other activities.

questions.question: What functionality does the 'Subs' menu offer?
questions.answer: The 'Subs' menu is for managing subscribers, allowing you to perform any actions related to managing your audience.

questions.question: What options are available under the 'Admin' menu?
questions.answer: The 'Admin' menu provides access to settings where you can configure various aspects of your account.

questions.question: What is the 'Chooser' in the application and where is it located?
questions.answer: The 'Chooser' is located in the bottom left of the main navigation bar and is where you can store all the files needed for your emails, such as images, Word documents, PDFs, and other files.

questions.question: How can you switch between multiple sub-accounts in the application?
questions.answer: If your account has multiple sub-accounts, you can toggle between them by clicking on your company name in the very top right of the app, where you'll see a list of available sub-accounts to switch into.

questions.answer: Support options include access to help resources and a log-out option located in the main navigation.

questions.answer: Files stored in the 'Chooser' can be used in your emails, including images, Word documents, PDFs, and other necessary files.

questions.question: What features are available in the 'Create' menu for dynamic content?
questions.answer: The 'Create' menu includes dynamic tools such as countdown clocks and image carousels, which can be used to enhance your emails and other content.
